decks.notes: The main strategy of this deck revolves around utilizing the Dredge ability on cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp to quickly fill your graveyard with creatures. Once you have enough creatures in your graveyard, you can use cards like Bridge from Below and Dread Return to bring back powerful threats from the graveyard for free. The deck also includes ways to discard cards like Faithless Looting and Careful Study to fuel your graveyard even faster. The aim is to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of creatures and graveyard recursion.

The main focus of this Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, backed up by disruptive spells such as Daze and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the game by utilizing countermagic and removal spells like Abrupt Decay, while also disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Stifle and Wasteland. Overall, the key strategy is to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure to secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through card advantage and reactive spells. By utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Snapcaster Mage, and Vendilion Clique, the deck aims to out-value the opponent by drawing cards, disrupting their plays, and protecting its own threats. The deck also has a strong control element with cards like Terminus, Swords to Plowshares, and Counterspell to deal with threats as they come up. Additionally, the deck aims to control the top of the opponent's library with Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to further disrupt their game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly put powerful creatures into the graveyard using cards like Entomb and Careful Study, and then bring them back onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Exhume. By using fast mana acceleration like Lotus Petal and Daze, along with disruption tools like Force of Will and Thoughtseize, this deck aims to cheat out large threats like Griselbrand, Elesh Norn, and Iona, overwhelming the opponent with an early game advantage and powerful creatures.

The key aspect of this deck is to control the game through powerful counterspells and removal spells while utilizing card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also includes powerful combo potential with Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top, creating a lock on the opponent's spells. Additionally, the inclusion of Terminus and Entreat the Angels allows the deck to control the board and win through powerful angel tokens. Finally, the splash of red with cards like Blood Moon and Wear / Tear adds versatility and disruption to the deck's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board with disruptive cards such as Hymn to Tourach and Abrupt Decay while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent to pressure the opponent. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with Ancestral Vision and Brainstorm, and has access to powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil for additional value. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements while also having utility lands like Wasteland and Creeping Tar Pit to disrupt the opponent further.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill out your opponent's deck in a single turn. The deck includes various ways to find and protect the combo pieces, such as Ponder, Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Intuition. Other cards like Goblin Welder and Lion's Eye Diamond help to accelerate the combo and generate mana. The deck also includes red elemental blasts to protect against opposing counterspells. The mana base includes a mix of artifact lands and dual lands to support the combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures through cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, then use reanimation spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate to bring them back to the battlefield for a game-ending combo. Cards like Sire of Insanity and Iona, Shield of Emeria can lock opponents out of the game while powerhouse creatures like Griselbrand can provide card advantage and pressure. This deck aims to execute its game plan efficiently and disrupt opponent's strategy with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Unmask.

The deck is built around maintaining control of the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and creatures to dictate the pace and outcome of the game. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Liliana of the Veil, Thoughtseize, and Abrupt Decay, while also applying pressure using efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Dark Confidant, and Stoneforge Mystic. The deck also has a strong equipment package with cards like Batterskull, Sword of Fire and Ice, and Umezawa's Jitte, providing additional ways to gain advantages and close out games.

The deck focuses on control elements with a mix of blue and white spells, aimed at disrupting opponents' strategies while maintaining card advantage. Key cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage provide powerful control options, complemented by interactive spells like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will. Card selection and manipulation are crucial with Ponder, Brainstorm, and Sensei's Divining Top, while the combination of Counterbalance and Top create a lock on opponents' spells. The deck aims to control the game tempo and win through card advantage and powerful threats like Entreat the Angels.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures using cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, then utilize cards like Dread Return to bring back powerful creatures like Flame-Kin Zealot for a game-ending combo. The deck also uses cards like Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy and Bridge from Below to generate additional creatures. This aggressive graveyard-based strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence and powerful combos, making it a potent threat in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main idea of this Legacy Aggro-Burn deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using efficient and low-cost burn spells like Chain Lightning, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt, while also utilizing creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear to apply pressure on the opponent. Cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Price of Progress punish opponents for playing spells or having non-basic lands, respectively. The deck aims to close out games quickly by overwhelming the opponent with direct damage and efficient creatures.

The core idea of this deck is to relentlessly attack the opponent's life total using aggressive creatures and burn spells. By consistently dealing damage early on, the deck aims to finish the game quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. With a focus on direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Price of Progress, the deck aims to pressure the opponent's life total and prevent them from setting up their game plan. The inclusion of snow-covered mountains and cards like Volcanic Fallout provide additional versatility and reach in dealing damage to the opponent.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly establish a dominant board presence by playing powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer early in the game. This is supported by controlling elements such as Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck is also built to have a mana advantage with lands like Ancient Tomb and Eye of Ugin, allowing the player to consistently play their high-cost Eldrazi creatures ahead of schedule.

The main concept of this Legacy Control - Lands deck is to utilize the interaction between lands and spells to control the opponent's resources. By utilizing powerful lands like Wasteland, Rishadan Port, and Maze of Ith alongside spells like Life from the Loam and Gamble, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base while setting up its own win condition with Thespian's Stage and Dark Depths. Additionally, cards like Molten Vortex and Abrupt Decay provide additional removal and disruption options to control the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently deal poison counters with the Infect mechanic, using cards like Glistener Elf, Blighted Agent, and Inkmoth Nexus. The deck also contains various pump spells like Berserk and Become Immense to enhance the damage output of the infect creatures. The deck runs a high number of protection and counter spells, such as Force of Will and Vines of Vastwood, to ensure the combo can go off uninterrupted. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to the necessary colors for spells and creatures.
